definition: to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: We read some, and mean to every day, " they all cried in chorus .
sentences.chinese: 我們讀了一點，以後每天都要讀，“姐妹們齊聲喊道。

sentences.english: The narrator bowed his head, and the boys shouted.
sentences.chinese: 敘述者低下頭來，和孩子們喊道。

sentences.english: Giovanni shouted as soon as he reached her.
sentences.chinese: 喬凡尼一到她的跟前便大聲喊道。

sentences.english: "What's going on?" she yells out the window.
sentences.chinese: “發生什麼事了？”她對窗外喊道。

sentences.english: We'll take it step by step, " he growls."
sentences.chinese: 我們一步一步來，”韓磊大聲喊道。
“我們聽不見你說話，”有人喊道。

sentences.english: "Come down quickly," cried Bluebeard, "or I will come up to you."
sentences.chinese: “快下來”，藍鬍子喊道，“不然我就上你那兒去。”

sentences.english: “Want help?” he calls from the side door.
sentences.chinese: 需要幫忙嗎？”他從側門那邊喊道。

sentences.english: All the best , " called the other typists in chorus."
sentences.chinese: “祝萬事如意，”其他打字員齊聲喊道。

sentences.english: We all shouted as we got Haran to come along.
"I wish Melly would keep her mouth shut, " cried Scarlett.
sentences.chinese: “我但願媚蘭閉住她那張嘴纔好，”思嘉大聲喊道。

sentences.english: A group of monkey run over to the well. They look at the moon in the well and shout.
sentences.chinese: 一羣猴子跑到井邊來，他們看到井裏的月亮，喊道。

sentences.english: Rachel shouts. You got quite a load there too.
sentences.chinese: 拉切爾喊道，你的裝載量也很大呀。

definition: (of yamen bailiffs etc) to walk ahead of an official, shouting at pedestrians to clear the way
to desist/to stop/to stay one's hand
to argue noisily/to shout/to make widely known/to reproach
to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)
to shout loudly/to raise a cry/to yell
